name: Archon War
desc: The war for the divine thrones, declared by the Heavenly Principles. As a result of the Archon War that finished about 2000 years ago, seven rulers of seven nations received the Gnoses, the divine throne, and the title of an Archon.

contents.text: Mondstadt
About 3000 years ago, the Great Wolf King of the North waged a war with the God of Storm, Decarabian.
About 2600 years ago, the people of Mondstadt rebelled against the tyranny of Decarabian. A wind elemental, Barbatos, absorbed the powers of the defeated god.
Andrius made peace with Barbatos and refused the divine throne.
Barbatos became the Anemo Archon.
Liyue
More than 4000 years ago, Morax, Guizhong, and Adepti of the south fought with other Liyue gods, including Orobashi, Osial and his wife, Beisht, Chi, Baqiu, and the goddess of Chenyu Vale.
The God of Salt, Havria, willingly withdrew from the Archon War.
Havria was killed by her people who thought that death was better than defeat.
Guizhong was killed, and Morax, along with the Adepti, went south and founded the Liyue Harbor 3,700 years ago.
Tao Dou sacrificed himself to become a border between the worlds of living and dead.
Morax defeated all other gods and became the Geo Archon.
Enkanomiya
Orobashi fled from Morax and Raiden to Byakuyakoku (Enkanomiya), which was in the Dark Sea.
Orobashi became the god of Byakuyakoku and promised people to lead them to the surface.
Orobashi learned the secrets that preceded the gods, and the Heavenly Principles pushed him to sacrifice himself so that the Enkanomiyans could live.
2000 years ago, Orobashi created Watatsumi Island near Inazuma.
Orobashi attacked the Inazuman armies and was killed by Raiden Ei so that the people of Watatsumi could live under Raidenâ€™s protection.
Inazuma
Raiden Makoto and Raiden Ei defeated the other gods, and Makoto became the Electro Archon and Ei became her shadow.
Sumeru
King Deshret defeated the other gods, including Remus and Bifrons, who later left Sumeru.
King Deshret renounced the divine throne and began to rule together with the Goddess of Flowers and Greater Lord Rukkhadevata.
King Deshret wanted to get rid of the cycle of seven.
The Goddess of Flowers sacrificed herself so that King Deshret could receive forbidden knowledge.

From the forbidden knowledge, Irminsul was infected, and Eleazar and other disasters appeared in Sumeru. To save Sumeru, the Greater Lord spent most of her strength, and King Deshret sacrificed himself.
Rukkhadevata became the Dendro Archon.
Fontaine
The Heart of the Primordial Sea, Egeria, was imprisoned by Celestia for committing the original sin.
While Egeria was imprisoned, Remus arrived from Sumeru to Meropis (Fontaine), refusing to serve King Deshret.

Remus met the seer Sybilla, who foretold him of the creation of a great empire that would fall within a century. Knowing that fate could not be resisted, Remus descended to the land of Meropis along with Sybilla and founded Remuria, bringing civilization and prosperity to the people.

In an attempt to free himself from the shackles of fate, Remus created the Grand Symphony, which united all the desires and thoughts of the Remurians. The Grand Symphony led to the fall of the empire.
Egeria was freed from her imprisonment and received a piece of the Primordial One, becoming the Hydro Archon.
Natlan

When the desert kingdoms of Sumeru were divided into fragmented states, the mortal Xbalanque defeated the Firelord Xiuhcoatl, who was corrupted by the Abyss, and rose from the flames to become the Pyro Archon.
Xbalanque took the powers of the Ruler of Death, Ronova, to declare the rules of Natlan: the Ode of Resurrection and the Pilgrimage of the Return of the Sacred Flame.
